heroSubtitle1: A Sacred Encounter with Ancestral Medicines
heroSubtitle2: A space for deep healing, care, and transformation.

guidesPageSubtitle: Meet the team of spiritual guides and facilitators who will accompany you on your healing journey. Each one brings their unique experience and wisdom.
errorUpdatingGuide: There was an error updating the guide.
whatIsAyahuascaDescription: Ayahuasca is an ancestral brew used by indigenous cultures of the Amazon for healing and spiritual purposes. It is made from the combination of two plants: the Ayahuasca vine (Banisteriopsis caapi) and other plants.
howAyahuascaWorksDescription: Ayahuasca acts as an inner guide, facilitating the exploration of consciousness and access to deep knowledge about oneself and the universe. Its purpose is to help you cleanse the body, release stagnant emotions, and reconnect with your true essence.
spiritualMasterDescription: Ayahuasca helps you reconnect with your inner self, with nature, and with the divine. It facilitates the expansion of consciousness and the development of intuition. Through the ceremony, you can experience a deep connection with ancestral wisdom and the vital energy of the universe.
ceremonyBenefitsTitle: Benefits of the Ceremony: Clarity, Healing, and Liberation
ayahuascaBenefitClarityDescription: Gain a greater understanding of yourself, your motivations, and your life purpose through deep and revealing visions.
ayahuascaBenefitHealingDescription: Release traumas, fears, and emotional blockages that prevent you from moving forward on your path, healing past wounds and opening space for love and compassion.
ayahuascaBenefitConnectionDescription: Ayahuasca helps you reconnect with nature, value life, and understand the importance of caring for the planet. It fosters the development of ecological awareness and a commitment to sustainability.
preparationCtaDescription: Proper preparation is essential for a deep and transformative experience. Learn about the process, diet, and what you need to bring.
preparationProcessDescription: Before the ceremony, it is recommended to follow a vegetarian or vegan diet for the 7 days prior, avoiding red meats, processed foods, alcohol, marijuana, and other drugs. It is important to report any medication you are taking, as some may interact with Ayahuasca.
ceremonyProcessDescription: The ceremony is held in a sacred space, in an atmosphere of respect, safety, and containment. Chants, music, and prayers are used to facilitate the connection with Ayahuasca.
experienceProcessDescription: Each person experiences Ayahuasca uniquely. It is possible to have visions, intense emotions, memories, and physical sensations. We offer support and guidance throughout the process.
integrationProcessDescription: After the ceremony, it is important to take time to reflect on the experience and process the emotions. We offer support to facilitate the integration of the teachings.
dietSubtitle: A special diet is key to preparation. Learn about the allowed and prohibited foods before the ceremony.
allowedFoodsList: Grains (rice, lentils, chickpeas, quinoa, oats, etc.)
prohibitedFoodsList: Processed foods and fast food (canned, fried, industrial snacks)
mentalPrepSubtitle: Meditation and setting intentions are fundamental. Prepare your mind and heart for the experience.
emotionalHealingDescription: Ayahuasca facilitates the healing of emotional traumas and the release of blockages that hinder your personal growth. Through the ceremony, you can access repressed memories, understand the origin of your emotional wounds, and release pain and suffering. The facilitators accompany you in this process, offering support and containment. It allows for profound transformation and the rebuilding of a full and meaningful life, free from the burdens of the past.
whatToBringSubtitle: Prepare your essentials for a comfortable and focused experience.
essentialsList: Notebook or journal for your reflections
Object with meaning for your altar or intention (optional)
